title: Retail Designer
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019 and continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
We want to be the leading global omnichannel retailer in the sports and outdoor industry. To be a part of this successful company and help us to achieve this you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people-led, innovative and customer-focused organisation which provides operational excellence whilst identifying new areas of growth as part of our day to day objectives.
The Property Design Team: The Property Design Team are responsible for driving innovation and design excellence across all of the JD Group brands on a global scale. The department delivers inspiring, commercial retail environments for our customers to maximise their shopping experience, whilst maximising profitability for the group. This includes the strategic direction of large, complex store build programmes consisting of new, up-size and refurbishment projects with a specific focus on cost, time, and quality parameters. The team are continually reviewing processes to improve value, reduction of costs and optimisation of all store design and build programmes.
The Role:The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
Responsibilities:

Lead design projects within agreed territory, taking projects from brief through to completion
 Attendance of strategy meetings to obtain design briefs and general direction of projects
Assist with the on-going development of the JD Store design specific to the assigned territory
Liaising with key project stakeholders at varying stages of projects, working closely with internal departments (Acquisitions team, Project managers, Quantity surveyors,Retail, Merchandising, Marketing, Multichannel, IT, Security, Health and Safety etc.)
Coordinate meetings to present store designs and obtain feedback and approval
Attend site meetings; talking through the design with the project delivery team, check surveys and record site information, ensuring all data is up to date in all documentation.
Set up drawings in AutoCAD using landlords or survey information ensuring all work is accurate
Space plan merchandise layouts using a design brief and option targets
Production of detailed plans, shop fronts, sections and elevations for proposed store designs and site-specific details where required
Liaise with external professional agencies such as architects, MEP and structural engineers, permitting departments in order to obtain statutory approvals
Offer assistance and support to the global design studio to support workload in other regions as / when time permits
Partner with the GHQ graphics team to deliver project specific designs

Position Requirements:

Previous experience within a similar role is essential
Manage architects and MEP consultants with regard to store design across asigned teritory
 Experience in a creative role with a leading retail design agency or in-house design team
 Proven experience at all stages of the design process, from conception through to implementation 
Strong retail and commercial awareness, specifically within the sports fashion industry
 Ability to negotiate and influence at all levels with both internal and external stakeholders
Design creatively to set budgets, demonstrating an understanding of construction costs
Plan work streams and set deadlines for both yourself and 3rd party consultants
Interpret briefs accurately and efficiently to deadlines
Strong communication and presentation skills
Self-motivated and driven, with the ability to manage own workload and deadlines
Strong spatial awareness
Detailed understanding of construction or shop fitting coupled with a strong understanding of permit regulations
Be prepared to travel and stay away from home when necessary
Must hold a valid passport
Full driving licence

Skills:

Expert level AutoCAD with working knowledge of how to build dynamic blocks
Proficient in the use of Adobe Creative Cloud suite
Experience of Revit is desirable
Expert in visual rendering and 3D modelling
Ability to use all Microsoft Office programs
An interest in the use and specification of sustainablematerials and construction methods

Qualifications:

Degree in Architecture, Architectural Technology, Interior Design or other relevant qualification

We know our employees work tirelessly to make JD Sports the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Staff Discount On JD Group and other brands within the organisation
Pension Scheme
Personal development opportunities to learn and develop at work.

Due to the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it takes time to review them all. If you don't hear back within two weeks of you applying, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful on this occasion
Applications that meet the skills criteria will be contacted for a 1st stage meeting with the talent team. Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to interview with the hiring manager.
Thank you again for your time.
